Our data demonstrate that the PROTEIN protein acts as a global repressor of the PROTEIN operon, as well as other class III heat shock genes, by preventing unstressed transcription from either the PROTEIN1 or PROTEIN2 dependent promoter and might be inactivated or dissociate under inducing stress conditions.
